an3.56:4.1: Then a senior Brahmin went up to the Buddha,
an3.56:4.2: and seated to one side he said to him:
an3.56:4.3: “Master Gotama, I have heard that brahmins of the past who were elderly and senior, the teachers of teachers, said:
an3.56:4.4: ‘In the old days this world was as crowded as hell. The villages, towns and capital cities were a chicken’s flight apart.’
an3.56:4.5: What is the cause, sir, what is the reason why these days human numbers have dwindled, with an obvious decline in population, and whole villages, towns, cities, and countries have disappeared?”
an3.56:5.1: “These days, brahmin, humans just love illicit lust. They’re overcome by unethical greed, and mired in wrong practices.
an3.56:5.2: Taking up sharp knives, they murder each other. And so many people perish.
an3.56:5.3: This is the cause, this is the reason why these days human numbers have dwindled.
an3.56:6.1: Furthermore, because these days humans just love illicit lust …
an3.56:6.2: the heavens don’t provide enough rain,
an3.56:6.3: so there’s famine, a bad harvest, with blighted crops that turn to straw.
an3.56:6.5: This is the cause, this is the reason why these days human numbers have dwindled.
an3.56:7.1: Furthermore, because these days humans just love illicit lust …
an3.56:7.2: native spirits unleash vicious monsters. And so many people perish.
an3.56:7.3: This is the cause, this is the reason why these days human numbers have dwindled.”
an3.56:8.2: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
